responsibilities: Lead the design, implementation, and testing of data systems from architecture to production.
Contribute to the development of long-term data strategies and roadmaps.
Develop and maintain the “source of truth” data environment for Klaviyo.
Architect and productionize batch and real-time data systems for various needs.
Build ETLs to ingest multiple terabytes of data per day and support multi-petabyte data models.
Ensure the quality, performance, and stability of data systems through robust quality systems and monitoring practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Platform Engineering, Security, Product, Finance, Go-To-Market, Customer Success, Support, Sales, and Marketing.
Build data governance solutions into the platform, ensuring compliance and security standards.
Mentor and coach team members to enhance their skills and performance.
skills: Strong understanding of cloud technologies, particularly AWS.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tooling such as Terraform.
Expertise in database design, including 3NF, dimensional modeling, data vault, or star schema.
Experience with Big Data technologies like Snowflake, Databricks/Spark, Trino.
Experience building real-time data pipelines and working with massive amounts of semi-structured data.
Knowledge of data and cloud engineering best practices.
Experience with Docker and container orchestration services like ECS, Kubernetes.
Experience building data products with a security-first mindset.
Ability to clearly communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for learning new technologies and staying current with industry trends.
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills listed focus primarily on data systems architecture, data engineering, and cloud technologies. The responsibilities include designing and implementing data systems, developing data strategies, building ETLs, and ensuring data quality and governance. The skills required include expertise in cloud technologies, database design, big data technologies, and container orchestration. There is no mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is on data engineering and infrastructure rather than AI model development or deployment.
